snippet: The damage inflicted on the New York’s metropolitan transit systems by Hurricane Sandy will cost more than $7 billion in repairs and billions more to upgrade the systems.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority chairman Joseph J Lhota and other officials tell United States Senate panel that it will cost more than $7 billion in repairs and billions more to upgrade systems to withstand future major storms; MTA sustained estimated damage of more than $5 billion from Hurricane Sandy; securing money beyond cost of repairs is a challenge while Congress and Pres Obama work to resolve fiscal cliff.
lead_paragraph: The damage inflicted on the New York’s metropolitan transit systems by Hurricane Sandy will cost more than $7 billion in repairs and billions more to upgrade the systems.
